author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Gold Prices Fall on Stronger Dollar
text:
Gold prices fell Tuesday, once again hurt by a stronger dollar and the prospect of higher interest rates.
Front-month gold for April delivery closed down less than 0.1% at $1,347.20 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have stayed this year between about $1,305 and $1,360, moving within that range based on appetite for safer assets, moves in the dollar and projections for higher interest rates.
